jobDescription: Under the supervision of UC Davis and the general direction of the Chief of the CalREDIE Surveillance Section of CDPH, the IAPD Data Quality Analyst II will be responsible for providing both corrective and preventive data quality interventions on incoming and existing data for CalREDIE electronic case reporting (eCR). The IAPD Data Quality Analyst II executes data quality protocols for CalREDIE eCR, and oversees data modifications to correct errors and serves as a liaison between the electronic health record system vendors to facilitate troubleshooting of database tables where data quality issues are researched and pinpointed and the electronic and manual data sources to resolve data quality issues.REQUIRED--Experience of public health reporting standards and ability to apply local and national standards consistently --Experience of eCR (electronic case reporting)/eICR (electronic initial case report) terminology and practices, and the data elements that support them; and ability to quickly learn data fields commonly used in clinic practices to record clinical visit encounters--Experience with national initiatives such as Meaningful Use, and their impact on eCR and health information exchange--Experience or knowledge of relevant eCR standards and terminology, including HL7 CDA R--Experience or knowledge of electronic data transfer methods--Skills to perform data comparisons, identify and troubleshoot issues quickly and efficiently, document status, monitor output of projects and processes--Skills to develop specific goals; balance multiple, competing program demands and develop plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish tasks--Skills to coordinate diverse activities to ensure completion of projects, tasks and assignments--Skills utilizing common software products such as Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel--Skills to adopt complex, modern information technology and communication tools--Knowledge of health related vendor products such as EHRs--Ability to contribute as a strong member of a self-directed work team and work independently with little or no supervision--Ability to apply high attention to detail to work products within a high-pressure environment--Ability to build mutual trust, respect and cooperation among team members--Ability to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical audiences in both written and verbal methods, clearly express ideas using appropriate language, and organize ideas in an objective manner with thorough translation/explanation of information--Ability to effectively communicate the capabilities and limitations of information technologies, including quickly learning new terminologySPECIAL REQUIREMENT - THIS POSITION MAY BE SUBJECT TO A CRIMINAL BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION, DRUG SCREEN, LIVE SCAN FINGERPRINTING, MEDICAL EVALUATION CLEARANCE, AND FUNCTIONAL CAPACITY ASSESSMENT
